# VZNetworkDeviceConfiguration

**Class**

The common configuration traits for network devices.

## Declaration

```swift
class VZNetworkDeviceConfiguration
```

## Overview

Don’t instantiate the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZNetworkDeviceConfiguration] class directly. Instead, instantiate one of its subclasses, such as [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioNetworkDeviceConfiguration]. Then use the properties of this class to configure the network device.

## Setting configuration attributes

- **attachment**: The object that defines how the virtual network device communicates with the host system.
- **macAddress**: The media access control (MAC) address to assign to the network device.

## Configurations

- **VZVirtioNetworkDeviceConfiguration**: A configuration object that requests the creation of a network device for the guest system.
- **VZMACAddress**: The media access control (MAC) address for a network interface in your virtual machine.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- VZVirtioNetworkDeviceConfiguration

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
